Posted By: Troutz (8/14/2010 11:13:30 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The typical use of Ajani is to use his second ability 4 times in a row. When he dies, cast another on and use the second ability on the same turn. So Ajani has a bad concept. He is more powerful than most of the other planeswalker from the "early days", but his stats feel so random.   
  
The first ability is comparable with a hasty [Honden of Cleansing Fire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Honden of Cleansing Fire) or some other permanents with a "gain life" ability. He can be used with [Zur's Weirding](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zur's Weirding) to ensure a win on the long run. But usually, you take the "plus" ability to get the ultimate power. In his case, the last ability is just a single token. The creature doesn't have haste or any evasion ability. So it's a [Serra Avatar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Avatar). But usually, you want to sneak such a creature into play early, when your life total is still high enough.  
  
So if I would have designed the card, I would have increased the loyality bonus. This doesn't hurt in any case. In addition, I would have changed the ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
The typical use of Ajani is to use his second ability 4 times in a row. When he dies, cast another on and use the second ability on the same turn. So Ajani has a bad concept. He is more powerful than most of the other planeswalker from the "early days", but his stats feel so random.

The first ability is comparable with a hasty Honden of Cleansing Fire or some other permanents with a "gain life" ability. He can be used with Zur's Weirding to ensure a win on the long run. But usually, you take the "plus" ability to get the ultimate power. In his case, the last ability is just a single token. The creature doesn't have haste or any evasion ability. So it's a Serra Avatar. But usually, you want to sneak such a creature into play early, when your life total is still high enough.

So if I would have designed the card, I would have increased the loyality bonus. This doesn't hurt in any case. In addition, I would have changed the ... (see all)

posts.post_content:
Ajani's 2011 signature spells ([Ajani's Mantra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ajani's Mantra) and [Ajani's pridemate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ajani's pridemate)) is, in my opinion one of the better combos that comes with the signatures. The second best is:  
  
T1: [forest](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=forest), [llanowar elves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=llanowar elves)  
T2: forest, [leatherback baloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=leatherback baloth)  
T3: forest, [garruk wildspeaker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=garruk wildspeaker), untap 2 lands, [garruk's companion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=garruk's companion)
posts.html:

Posted By: made4ipod (1/2/2011 4:33:01 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
His first ability is way too weak unless ur running some kind of strategy with lifegain. His 2nd ability is extremly good for white beatdowns. And his ultimate is laughable. 20+/20+ looks nice but in reality it can be chumpblocked by anything and takes a while to come out. Not to mention valnerable to all forms creature removeal and bounce. Then again u can give it whispersilk or something but still...
  
   
   
Should have really made it +3 life ((and compaired with jace this still would be weak)) and made his ulitmate beter. Not saying give the demigod evasion, but maby shroud would have forced them to chump block but then again with [darksteel myr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=darksteel myr) running around, that dosent look too hot either.
  
   
Another idea for an alternative ultimate would be double or maby even triple your life total. That would defitally make more incentive to prevent the ultimate especially if its +3 life gain over +2.
  
   
Overrall a great addition to any white weenie beatdown. 4/5
posts.html:
His first ability is way too weak unless ur running some kind of strategy with lifegain. His 2nd ability is extremly good for white beatdowns. And his ultimate is laughable. 20+/20+ looks nice but in reality it can be chumpblocked by anything and takes a while to come out. Not to mention valnerable to all forms creature removeal and bounce. Then again u can give it whispersilk or something but still...


Should have really made it +3 life ((and compaired with jace this still would be weak)) and made his ulitmate beter. Not saying give the demigod evasion, but maby shroud would have forced them to chump block but then again with darksteel myr running around, that dosent look too hot either.

Another idea for an alternative ultimate would be double or maby even triple your life total. That would defitally make more incentive to prevent the ultimate especially if its +3 life gain over +2.

Overrall a great addition to any white weenie beatdown. 4/5
